front.title: Security Requirements for the Geopriv Location System

abstract.t: Internet protocols that deal with presence-based location objects support a wide variety of applications. However, the dissemination of location objects from sources of location to consumers is a common feature of all location-based applications. In order to enable the development of broadly-applicable security and privacy mechanisms for dissemination of location objects, this document describes an end-to- end architecture for policy-constrained location distribution. In this architecture, location distribution is accomplished by a set of distributed actors. We describe the assurances that these actors require from the architecture, and derive more a more detailed description of the security features required to provide those assurances.
